alert.note: Alert for Palo Verde Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 02 at 7:00PM PST until February 02 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST /10 PM PST/ THIS EVENING... ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM MST /7 PM PST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...North winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * WHERE...In Arizona, Parker Valley. In California, Palo Verde Valley. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST /10 PM PST/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
